trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException"></xref> class is an exception that occurs when a DSML Request or Response document is not well-formed XML or cannot be validated with DSMLv2 schema.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException"></xref> class.
The default text message displayed to the client is "The DSML document could not be parsed."

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException.#ctor(System.String)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException"></xref> class using the specified parameter.
The message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException"></xref> class using the specified serialization data and streaming contextual data.
The serialized object data about the exception thrown.
The contextual data about the source or destination.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException"></xref> class using the specified parameters.
The message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.
The <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref>, if any, that threw the exception.
